dt: {bc}to ascertain the flavor of by taking a little into the mouth
{bc}to eat or drink especially in small quantities
{bc}to perceive or recognize as if by the sense of taste
{bc}to test the flavor of something by taking a small part into the mouth

et: Middle English, to touch, test, taste, from Anglo-French {it}taster{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*taxitare{/it}, frequentative of Latin {it}taxare{/it} to touch, feel {ma}{mat|tax:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: to ascertain the flavor of by taking a little into the mouth
to eat or drink especially in small quantities
to perceive or recognize as if by the sense of taste

leaves a bad taste in his mouth
leaves a bad taste in my mouth

leaving a bad taste in my mouth
leaving a bad taste in their mouths

dt: {bc}the special sense that perceives and distinguishes the sweet, sour, bitter, salty, or umami quality of a dissolved substance and is mediated by taste buds on the tongue
{bc}the objective sweet, sour, bitter, salty, or umami quality of a dissolved substance as perceived by the sense of taste
{bc}a sensation obtained from a substance in the mouth that is typically produced by the stimulation of the sense of taste combined with those of touch and smell {bc}{sx|flavor||}

dt.t: The way we were treated {phrase}left a bad taste in my mouth{/phrase} {gloss}=made me feel disgusted, bitter, etc.{/gloss}

dt: {bc}manner or aesthetic quality indicative of such discernment or appreciation

shortdef: the special sense that perceives and distinguishes the sweet, sour, bitter, salty, or umami quality of a dissolved substance and is mediated by taste buds on the tongue
the objective sweet, sour, bitter, salty, or umami quality of a dissolved substance as perceived by the sense of taste
a sensation obtained from a substance in the mouth that is typically produced by the stimulation of the sense of taste combined with those of touch and smell : flavor

dt: {bc}an end organ mediating the sensation of taste and lying chiefly in the epithelium of the tongue

shortdef: an end organ mediating the sensation of taste and lying chiefly in the epithelium of the tongue

dt: {bc}to experience pleasure as a result of defeating an opponent

dt.t: She has {it}tasted blood{/it} now, and can't wait to meet her rival on the court again.

shortdef: to experience pleasure as a result of defeating an opponent

dt: {bc}something (such as a brief experience) that is the first of similar things to follow

dt.t: That first storm was just a {it}taste of things to come{/it}.

shortdef: something (such as a brief experience) that is the first of similar things to follow

dt: {bc}something or someone that is not easily or immediately liked or appreciated

shortdef: something or someone that is not easily or immediately liked or appreciated

dt: used to say that something is based on taste

dt.t: Some people like seafood and some people don't. It's all just {it}a matter of taste{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that something is based on taste

dt: {bc}in the opinion of someone based on that person's feelings about what is appealing, attractive, etc.

dt.t: The music is too loud {it}for my taste{/it}.

shortdef: in the opinion of someone based on that person's feelings about what is appealing, attractive, etc.

dt.t: Some people felt that her behavior wasn't in {it}good taste{/it}.
I think the joke he told was {it}in (very) bad/poor taste{/it}.
